Gov: Phil Scott argues that the tax proposal would impact middle-class families, not just wealthy residents.
Lt: Gov. David Zuckerman's campaign disputes Gov. Scott's numbers and claims that the top 5% of earners start at households earning $294,000 per year.
The Vermont Department of Taxes: analysis from 2018 data supports the claim that the top 5% starts at $159,000 in taxable income.
